etymologies: late 18th century: via Afrikaans from Dutch, ‘elk’, from obsolete German Elend, from Lithuanian élnis

definitions: a spiral-horned African antelope that lives in open woodland and grassland. It is the largest of the antelopes.

notes.text: Genus Taurotragus, family Bovidae: the giant eland (T. derbianus) and the common eland (T. oryx)

shortDefinitions: large spiral-horned African antelope which lives in open woodland and grassland
